sen.j: 舞鶴引揚記念館（まいづるひきあげきねんかん、英語：Maizuru Repartriation Memorial Museum）は、京都府舞鶴市にある歴史伝承施設である。
sen.e: Maizuru Repatriation Memorial Museum is a facility for preservation of historical artifacts and tradition in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture
Maizuru Repatriation Memorial Museum is a facility for preservation of historical artifacts and tradition in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture
The Maizuru Repatriation Memorial Museum is a facility for preservation of historical artifacts and tradition in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 舞鶴港は、戦中は旧海軍の軍事的拠点として使用されていたが、戦後は大陸に進駐していた軍人軍属や一般人の日本本土への引揚、および日本に在留していた中国・朝鮮人の送還のための指定港のひとつとなった。
sen.e: The Port of Kyoto-Maizuru functioned as a military base for the Imperial Navy, and after the war, the port was designated as one of the ports for repatriated soldiers and people from mainland China, as well as for sending back Chinese and Koreans who had been expatriates in Japan.

The Port of Kyoto-Maizuru functioned as a military base for the Imperial Navy, and after the war the port was designated as one of the ports of entry for repatriated soldiers and people from mainland China as well as the departure point for Chinese and Koreans who had been expatriates in Japan.

The Port of Kyoto-Maizuru functioned as a military base for the Imperial Navy, and after the war the port was designated as one of the ports of entry for repatriated soldiers and people from mainland China as well as the departure point for Chinese and Koreans who had been expatriates in Japan.

sen.j: さらに、日ソ中立条約を一方的に破棄し侵攻したソビエト連邦軍によってシベリアに不法抑留されていた旧軍人についても、舞鶴へと帰還した。
sen.e: Also, former soldiers, who had been illegally detained in Siberia by Soviet army that unilaterally breached Soviet-Japanese Neutrality Pact to invade, returned to Japan through this port.
Also, former soldiers who had been illegally detained in Siberia by Soviet army, which unilaterally breached Soviet-Japanese Neutrality Pact and invaded, returned to Japan through this port.
Also, former soldiers who had been illegally detained in Siberia by Soviet army, which unilaterally breached Soviet-Japanese Neutrality Pact and invaded, returned to Japan through this port.

sen.j: 他港が早々に引揚港から除かれたため、これら引揚の人々のほとんどが、舞鶴港を入港先・帰還港とした。
sen.e: Since other ports were removed from the designation for repatriations at an early stage, almost all these repatriated people arrived in the Port of Kyoto-Maizuru.
Because other ports had been removed from the designation for repatriations at an early stage, nearly all these repatriated people arrived at the Port of Kyoto-Maizuru.
Because other ports had been removed from the designation for repatriations at an early stage, nearly all these repatriated people arrived at the Port of Kyoto-Maizuru.

sen.j: これに伴い、日本各地から夫や親族の帰還を待ち望む多くの人々が、舞鶴港へと出迎えに訪れた。
sen.e: For this reason, many people who had anxiously longed for returns of their husbands and relatives came to this port from all over Japan to welcome them.
For this reason, many people who had anxiously longed for the return of their husbands, fathers, sons and relatives came to this port from all over Japan to welcome them.
For this reason, many people who had anxiously longed for the return of their husbands, fathers, sons and relatives came to this port from all over Japan to welcome them.

sen.j: 1988年(昭和63年)、多くの関係者の努力により、引揚に関わる一連の資料を展示する日本唯一の施設として設立されたのが、この舞鶴引揚記念館である。
sen.e: Many concerned people helped to establish Maizuru Repatriation Memorial Museum in 1988 as the only facility in Japan that exhibits the series of documents about the repatriation.
Many concerned people helped to establish the Maizuru Repatriation Memorial Museum in 1988 as Japan's only facility for the exhibition of documents concerning the repatriation.
Many concerned people helped to establish the Maizuru Repatriation Memorial Museum in 1988 as Japan's only facility for the exhibition of materials concerning the repatriation.

sen.j: 引揚者用の桟橋が設置されていた平地区を見下ろす丘に引揚記念公園が開設され、その一角に記念館が建設された。
sen.e: Repatriation Memorial Park was made on the hill overlooking Taira District where landing bridges for repatriates had been placed, and this Memorial Museum was built at the corner of the park.
sen.cmt: 平地区→[定訳不明] Taira Area (District)
sen.e: Repatriation Memorial Park was created on a hill overlooking the Taira district, where landing bridges for repatriates had been placed, and the Memorial Museum was built in a corner of the park.
Repatriation Memorial Park was created on a hill overlooking the Taira district, where landing bridges for repatriates had been placed, and the Memorial Museum was built in a corner of the park.

sen.j: なお、2005年(平成17年)は海外引揚60周年に当たる年であり、当地では海外引揚第1船の入港した11月7日とその周辺に記念行事が開催された。
sen.e: In 2005, as the 60th anniversary of the repatriation fell upon the year, several memorial events were held on and around November 7, which was the date the first repatriation ship arrived in the port.
In 2005, the sixtieth anniversary of the repatriation, several memorial events were held on and around November 7, which was the date the first repatriation ship arrived at the port.
In 2005, the sixtieth anniversary of the repatriation, several memorial events were held on and around November 7, which was the date the first repatriation ship arrived at the port.

sen.j: 舞鶴市平無番地（電話番号：0773-68-0836）

sen.e: (The entrance gate is closed at 17:00 pm.)
Admission: fees in parentheses are for groups.
Admission: The fees shown in parentheses are for groups.
Admission: The fees shown in parentheses are for groups.

sen.j: 無料駐車場あり、大型バス可。
sen.e: Free of charge; available for motorcoaches
Free of charge; available for motorcoaches
Free of charge; available for motorcoaches

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道東舞鶴駅より、京都交通 (舞鶴)の路線バス三浜線もしくは田井・野原線で約15分、「引揚記念公園前バス停」下車。
sen.e: From Higashi Maizuru Station (West Japan Railway), take the bus of Mihama Route Tai Nohara Route (Kyoto Kotsu Maizuru), and get off at the "Hikiage Kinen Koen Mae Bus Stop" (time required: approximately 15 minutes).

From Higashi Maizuru Station (West Japan Railway), take the bus of Mihama Route Tai Nohara Route (Kyoto Kotsu Maizuru) and get off at the Hikiage Kinen Koen Mae bus stop (time required: approximately 15 minutes).

From Higashi Maizuru Station (West Japan Railway), take the bus of Mihama Route or Tai Nohara Route (Kyoto Kotsu Maizuru) and get off at the Hikiage Kinen Koen Mae bus stop (time required: approximately 15 minutes).

sen.j: JR東舞鶴駅より、舞鶴観光周遊バスで「引揚記念館バス停」下車。
sen.e: From Higashi Maizuru Station (JR), take Maizuru Sightseeing Bus, and get off at the "Hikiage Kinenkan Bus Stop."
From Higashi Maizuru Station (JR), take Maizuru Sightseeing Bus and get off at the Hikiage Kinenkan bus stop.
From Higashi Maizuru Station (JR), take the Maizuru Sightseeing Bus and get off at the Hikiage Kinenkan bus stop.

sen.j: 舞鶴若狭自動車道・舞鶴東インターチェンジより、京都府道28号小倉西舞鶴線、(京都府道51号舞鶴和知線)、国道27号を経て京都府道・福井県道21号舞鶴野原港高浜線を大浦半島方面へ約20分。
sen.e: From Maizuru Higashi Interchange (Maizuru-Wakasa Expressway), take Kyoto Prefectural road 28 Kokura Nishi Maizuru Route, (Kyoto Prefectural road 51 Maizuru Wachi Route), National Route 27, and drive headed for Oura Peninsula through Kyoto Prefectural road and Fukui Prefectural Route 21 Maizuru Noharako Takahama Route (time required: approximately 20 minutes).

From the Maizuru Higashi interchange on the Maizuru-Wakasa Expressway, take Kyoto Prefectural Road 28, Kokura Nishi Maizuru Route (Kyoto Prefectural Road 51, Maizuru Wachi Route), National Route 27, and head toward the Oura Peninsula via the Kyoto Prefectural Road and Fukui Prefectural Route 21, Maizuru Noharako Takahama Route (time required: approximately 20 minutes).

From the Maizuru Higashi interchange on the Maizuru-Wakasa Expressway, take Kyoto Prefectural Road 28, Kokura Nishi Maizuru Route (Kyoto Prefectural Road 51, Maizuru Wachi Route), National Route 27, and head toward the Oura Peninsula via the Kyoto Prefectural Road and Fukui Prefectural Route 21, Maizuru Noharako Takahama Route (time required: approximately 20 minutes).
